body: Hi all! I'm getting some weird results running a solar radiation study. When I run a study at the 20th of june at 12.00 noon, you'd expect a lot of sun, but the results are 0 (nighttime). If I go to 16.00,17.00 i finally start getting results, but the most 'warm' results i get when it's midnight around 1.00 2.00. It appears the time is shifted by 12.00, what might I be doing wrong? 12.00 [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/etaPLs1LEXIrXecQ5Ukpb1IYavQYw7KPuebf4XdYD3COcMwS-En3Iw6Mq2-7NStPDnSEgrwLwDaIBjw0q8EvddNhtVYjyNVC/03.jpg) 14.00 [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/etaPLs1LEXLjNWM6*Xzv*Gj18WRkq0vXzvg3-lyjy4CfZsJDQXuW0Xd0ccDoDX8EAa6mFAdO5w3MCfE7G69rlfqdP8VemqRB/00.jpg) 17.00 (first results, seems like sunrise) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/etaPLs1LEXJhQA7ZRpbDZoYQOc5YsgLYKII4xJ1ku5OeGhURaOwW1cIKROsvrz9ndkzfe7pqkS0JFaVXYbXNq5SVpJSZ*gDk/01.jpg) 2.00 (midnight, but seems to be noon) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/etaPLs1LEXKwHrXyfltEvCyefcxmQHg3f8LIdzTaD4Iryi1xRr3GGbSVAOlpoXITIetWsrZyzL9mOsX8UKXdicJYO0enM0v*/02.jpg)
